page.title: 17SYON HOUSE
page.content: The history of the house dates back to the 15th century and for many years it has been the family home of the Duchy of Northumberland.The house and gardens are open to visitors and receive a wide cross-section of adults and children. It is busier in the summer months with many foreign visitors. Admission fees pay for the considerable costs of upkeep of the 40 room house and the gardens and for a skeleton staff. When the Duke's family are in residence they have their own separate staff.The house has not been restored for some time. Among its attractions are many paintings and much furniture all of which is original.
